title: Cousins Properties, Tier Reit to Merge in Office-Landlord Deal
summary: The $5.9 billion, all-stock tie-up will focus the new company in hot Sunbelt markets, with an emphasis on Austin. Cousins Properties Inc. and Tier Reit Inc. have agreed to merge in a $5.9 billion all-stock deal, creating one of the largest Sunbelt office-building landlords with a focus on Austin, Atlanta and other fast-growing markets.

title: Part of Long Island's Sag Harbor Gains Historic Designation
summary: District known as SANS earns recognition along with 16 other sites statewide. A waterfront section of Sag Harbor that grew into a summer resort for black families after World War II has won a spot on the New York State Register of Historic Places.

title: Journal Shifts Strategy With Apple Deal
summary: Journal joins $9.99-a-month Apple news app, betting it can expand its digital customer base without undercutting paper's core business. The Wall Street Journal is a launch partner for Apple Inc.'s $9.99-a-month news service, marking a significant shift in strategy meant to draw in new readers and paying subscribers without undercutting the publication's core business.

title: Mueller Exposes Spy Chiefs
summary: Did our intel leaders have any evidence when they pushed the Russia collusion line?. Now that special counsel Robert Mueller has found that no one in the Trump campaign colluded with Russia to steal the 2016 election, Democrats are busy moving the goal posts. But this is a distraction from the real reckoning that needs to come.

title: NATO Is Dying, but Don't Blame Trump
summary: Germany reneges on defense commitments, thumbing its nose at the alliance.. Is NATO dying? The idea was once unthinkable, but after the German cabinet decided to keep defense spending as low as 1.25% of gross domestic product for the next five years it has become unavoidable. This decision is not driven by any fiscal urgency. Germany is projected to have a balanced budget after last year's surplus of €11.2 billion, its fifth annual surplus in a row.

title: 40 Years of Peace Between Israel and Egypt
summary: Sadat and Begin gambled everything, and the bet paid off.. Israel and Egypt have been at peace for 40 years. In a region beset by national, sectarian and tribal conflicts, the treaty between the two nations has endured since its signing on March 26, 1979. It has withstood the assassination in 1981 of Egyptian President Anwar Sadat, two Palestinian intifadas, two wars in Lebanon and the election of the Muslim Brotherhood's Mohammed Morsi as Egypt's president in 2012. Even though Mr. Morsi refused to deal directly with the Israelis-or say "Israel"-he did not walk away from the treaty during his year in power.

title: 'Silence' Review: The Rest Is Noise
summary: Silence is seemingly neutral but can be used as both a punitive tool and a liberating practice. Its meanings are lost in an era of nonstop sound.. The colonization of silence has been going on for years. Muzak piped into elevators and shopping malls seems almost quaint, now that televisions and video screens are everywhere-in waiting rooms, restaurants and taxis-and every stroll down a store aisle is accompanied by a pop soundtrack. Even pumps at the gas station blare music and weather updates, and earphones make it possible to go through an entire day listening to podcasts, phone conversations or a playlist of tunes. Our eagerness for nonstop sound suggests that mere quiet is an uncomfortable experience for many people.

title: ACA Sign-Ups Total 11.4 Million for This Year
summary: Enrollment declined by 300,000 amid debate over future of U.S. health policy. About 11.4 million people signed up for coverage on the Affordable Care Act's exchanges for this year, according to a final tally released Monday, amid sharp debates in Washington over the future of health coverage.

title: A Catastrophic Media Failure
summary: America's blue-chip journalists botched the Russia story from its birth to its final breath Sunday.. Robert Mueller's investigation is over, but questions still abound. Not about collusion, Russian interference or obstruction of justice, but about the leading lights of journalism who managed to get the story so wrong, and for so long.

title: Gerrymandering Disputes Don't Belong in Court
summary: The Framers left it to the legislative branch to draw district lines-and didn't anticipate political parties.. Not every day does the Supreme Court have a chance to advance democracy and reverse a major mistake while also lightening its future workload. But it can do all those things in two cases it hears Tuesday dealing with gerrymandering of congressional districts.

title: Trump's Golan Decision Is Moral and Strategic
summary: The vicious regime in Syria shouldn't be rewarded for trying to conquer Israel in 1967.. President Trump's tweeted last week that the U.S. will formally recognize the Golan Heights as part of Israel. The decision is strategically wise and morally important.

summary: 'You have a president, who in my opinion beyond the shadow of a doubt, sought to, however ham-handedly, collude with the Russian government.'. Amy Russoreporting for HuffPost.com, March 23:

title: Apple Pushes Beyond iPhone With New Services
summary: Tech giant launches suite of new products in pursuit of fresh revenue growth outside its core business. CUPERTINO, Calif.- Apple Inc. unveiled new products for entertainment, financial services, news and videogames as the technology giant vies with competitors that are also moving to expand their disruptive influence outside their core businesses in search of new growth.

title: Mueller Told Barr Weeks Ago He Wouldn't Reach Conclusion on Obstruction Charge
summary: Special counsel hasn't explained why he left open the question of whether President Trump obstructed justice. WASHINGTON-Special counsel Robert Mueller told top Justice Department officials three weeks before submitting a report on his investigation into Russian election interference that he wouldn't reach a conclusion on whether President Trump obstructed justice, a person familiar with the matter said.

title: Accountability for a Dossier
summary: The dirty trick that started the collusion fable needs exposing.. Special Counsel Robert Mueller has dispatched the Russia collusion theories to the land of cranks and bitter-enders, but there are still some loose ends. To wit, how did the partisan propaganda known as the Steele dossier become the basis for an unprecedented FBI probe of a presidential campaign, an abuse of law enforcement, and two years of media and political hysteria?

title: Russia's Venezuelan Power Play
summary: Putin is testing Trump by sending troops to back up Maduro.. The stakes for American interests keep rising in Venezuela, as Vladimir Putin is now moving his little green men to keep dictator Nicolás Maduro in power. U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo called his Russian counterpart Monday after Russian air force planes carrying about 100 troops arrived in Caracas Saturday.

title: Banks Get Break on Hedging
summary: Derivatives regulators loosen rules for regional bank swap trades. WASHINGTON-Banks will be able to more easily hedge against the risks of the loans they originate without triggering stricter regulatory requirements, under rule changes made Monday by a federal markets regulator.

title: McDonald's Buys Israeli Digital Startup Dynamic Yield
summary: The $300 million-plus deal marks the fast-food chain's biggest acquisition in two decades. McDonald's Corp. is buying Israeli digital startup Dynamic Yield Ltd., in a bid to improve in-store ordering and online marketing at the burger giant.

title: Brazil Ex-President Michel Temer Released After 4 Days in Jail
summary: Judge rules politician's preventive detention unjustified but he remains under investigation. SÃO PAULO-Brazil's former President Michel Temer was released from jail Monday, four days after his arrest on accusations of leading a criminal enterprise, after a federal judge ruled he doesn't represent a risk to public safety.

title: WeWork's Annual Loss Doubles to Nearly $2 Billion
summary: The company spent heavily last year to increase its network of shared offices. WeWork Cos. on Monday said its loss last year doubled to nearly $2 billion, as the nine-year-old company spent heavily in an effort to rapidly expand its network of shared offices around the world.

title: France's CMA CGM to Buy Chinese-Made Container Ships
summary: Order from government-run China State Shipbuilding announced during Chinese President Xi Jinping's visit to France. French shipping operator CMA CGM SA has ordered 10 container megaships from state-owned China State Shipbuilding Corp. as part of a string of deals that Chinese President Xi Jinping signed Monday with his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron.

title: NYPD Officers to Patrol Buses in Effort to Avert Fare Evasion
summary: Total subway and bus fare evasion cost the MTA $225 million last year. The Metropolitan Transportation Authority's head of New York City's subway and bus systems called for police officers to patrol buses to curb worsening fare evasion that led to more than $128 million in lost revenues in 2018.

title: Lyft Leading Wave of Startups That Will Make Debuts With Giant Losses

title: Moore Says Fed's Pivot Validates Criticism of Rate Increases
summary: Trump's latest pick for Fed board regrets 'harsh' tone of disapproval of Fed Chairman Powell. title: New Jersey Push for Pot Bill Fails
summary: State Senate lacked votes to move marijuana legislation. The New Jersey Senate scrapped plans Monday to vote on a bill legalizing recreational marijuana, dealing a blow to Gov. Phil Murphy's legislative agenda.

summary: FDA panel hears testimony from women over symptoms including pain and connective-tissue disease. Women with breast implants continue to report a range of illnesses they attribute to the devices, from pain, weakness and distorted breasts to connective-tissue disease and a rare cancer.

title: Shell Boosts Bet on North American LNG Exports
summary: Shell and Energy Transfer said they are putting contracts out for bid to reconfigure an existing import facility in Lake Charles, La.. Royal Dutch Shell PLC and Energy Transfer LP said they are pursuing plans to convert a liquefied-natural-gas import facility in Louisiana into an export terminal, a bet that the future of U.S. shale gas lies in selling it for higher prices in overseas markets.

title: Court Appearances Begin in College Admissions Scheme
summary: Prosecutors say they took millions in payments and bribes to help clients land their children at elite colleges. BOSTON-Prominent college coaches and defendants who allegedly arranged for fraudulently boosted ACT or SAT scores appeared in federal court here Monday as part of the largest college-admissions scandal ever prosecuted by the Justice Department.

title: Father of Sandy Hook Shooting Victim Dies of Apparent Suicide
summary: Jeremy Richman co-founded Avielle Foundation after 6-year-old daughter was killed in 2012 mass shooting. The father of a 6-year-old victim of the mass shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Conn., was found dead Monday morning of an apparent suicide, police said.

title: Emerging-Market Currencies Rebound
summary: Turkish lira, Russian ruble and others rise against dollar. Investors returned to high-yielding emerging-market currencies Monday, pushing many higher against the dollar following last week's selloff.

title: Canada Links Trade-Deal Approval to Steel Tariffs
summary: Ottawa official indicates ratification of new Nafta may not proceed unless import barrier removed. title: Newmont Tries to End Revolt Over Goldcorp Deal With Special Dividend

summary: Treasury yields fall amid renewed investor concerns about global growth slowdown. U.S. government-bond prices rose anew Monday, pushing the yield on the 10-year Treasury note to a nearly 15-month low, amid continued concerns about the outlook for global economic growth.

summary: Democrats have called for the swift release of the report and its underlying documents. title: Naspers to List Its $134 Billion Tencent Stake in Europe

title: Man Accused of Killing Reputed Mafia Boss is Charged With Murder
summary: Anthony Comello will be prosecuted in Staten Island for the death of Francesco Cali earlier this month. Police charged a Staten Island man with murder Monday for the killing of the reputed boss of the Gambino crime family earlier this month.

summary: Concerns about a global economic slowdown weigh on sentiment. •U.S. crude prices edged down Monday, falling for the second consecutive session as fears about a global economic slowdown gripped markets and stoked jitters about lower fuel consumption.

title: Swaths of Southern Africa Remain Inundated Following Cyclone Idai
summary: Nearly two weeks after storm hit Mozambique coast, survivors face threat of disease, ruined crops and destroyed houses. title: Mueller and the Obama Accounting
summary: The former President now owes the country an explanation for the historic abuse of government surveillance powers.. The Mueller report confirms that the Obama administration, without evidence, turned the surveillance powers of the federal government against the presidential campaign of the party out of power. This historic abuse of executive authority was either approved by President Barack Obama or it was not. It's time for Mr. Obama, who oddly receives few mentions in stories about his government's spying on associates of the 2016 Trump campaign, to say what he knew and did not know about the targeting of his party's opponents.

title: With End of Islamic State Caliphate, U.S. Shifts to Long New Fight Ahead

title: Four New Handbag Lines Promise Euro Chic-For Under $1,000
summary: The new class of "It" bag has a surprising characteristic: affordability. Offerings from Polène, Wandler, Danse Lente and Hunting Season are highly stylish and less than $1,000. Walk down any rue in Paris these days and you're likely to see someone wearing the bag du jour. It's not a Chanel, a Louis Vuitton or even an Hermés-though it is produced by the same Spanish manufacturer as the latter. Rather, it's a Polène, named after the Normandy country house of its founders: Mathieu, Antoine and Elsa Mothay, three siblings whose great-grandfather launched the storied French clothing line Saint James. The signature silhouette, the Numéro Un Mini ($330), comes in a variety of leather combinations-calfskin suede, full-grain textured-and hues like forest green or sand. "We don't have any color that is not selling," says co-founder Mathieu Mothay who with his brother and sister opened Polène's flagship store in Paris's Le Marais neighborhood in December. "The most important thing, and our success, is due to the high quality of the product."

title: North Korea Returns to Liaison Office With South Days After Pulling Out
summary: Pyongyang watchers call it a sign the North remains open to diplomacy with Seoul and Washington. SEOUL-North Korean officials reversed course and returned to talks with the South at a joint liaison office near their border, a sign Pyongyang remains open to diplomacy with Seoul and Washington after their detente had shown signs of strain.

title: How a Merger Between Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank Stacks Up
summary: A deal between the struggling lenders could give much-needed support to Germany's economy-but skepticism is rife. FRANKFURT-The idea behind merging two of Europe's weakest financial institutions-Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank-is that together, they can somehow lean on each other and steady their fortunes.

title: Some Startup Founders Leave Silicon Valley 'Bubble' and Head East
summary: Entrepreneurs say New York has skilled workers, investors, proximity to finance and retail industries.

title: Derby's Take: If Moore Makes Fed Governor, He'd Be Like None Other
summary: Resume Subscription. The Federal Reserve, especially its Washington-based governors, have long liked to put a united face to the world. That may be about to change.

title: Theresa May Faces Growing Dissatisfaction Over Brexit
summary: Speculation rises cabinet is on brink of ejecting Mrs. May from office; jostling comes ahead of another week when lawmakers will try to resolve conundrum. LONDON-Prime Minister Theresa May is facing fresh questions about whether she can stay in office long enough to see Brexit through, as lawmakers enter another critical week of decisions over the U.K.'s departure from the European Union.

title: Chicago Fed President Evans Doesn't See Rate Rise Until Second Half of 2020
summary: Chicago Fed leader says downside risks now 'loom larger' than positive risks. HONG KONG-Chicago Fed President Charles Evans said Monday that he doesn't expect an interest-rate increase in the U.S. until next year, probably in the second half.

title: The Perils of Heading Abroad for the Fed
summary: Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Charles Evans is in Hong Kong for an investment conference. It's never easy being a representative of the world's most important central bank abroad-especially on a day when the U.S. Treasury yield curve has just inverted and Asian financial markets are tanking.

title: Nintendo to Launch Two New Switch Models
summary: The new gaming consoles will be released as early as this summer. Nintendo Co. plans to launch two new versions of its Switch gaming console as early as this summer, people familiar with the matter said, as the company seeks to sustain sales momentum for the product going into a crucial third year.

title: With the iPhone Sputtering, Apple Bets Future on TV, News
summary: Resume Subscription. The iPhone is running out of juice. To go beyond the device that made Apple Inc. a global colossus, Tim Cook is betting on a suite of services-marking the company's biggest shift in more than a decade.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: A New Person Is in Charge of the Perot Family Fortune
summary: Boaz Sidikaro, veteran hedge-fund trader, is taking the reins from Steve Blasnik. The Perot family in Dallas has hired a veteran hedge-fund trader as its new investment chief.

title: How to Get the Most Out of a Second Home
summary: Buying the right kind of home, tech tools to help you manage it, rules for rentals, and other tips. Owning two homes can be a headache-a headache worth having, to be sure, but a headache nonetheless.

title: Tax Law Is Full of Exceptions
summary: Before doing your taxes, read the fine print. Experts say the new tax rules aren't as black and white as they might seem. An Internal Revenue Service official once introduced me to the rule of PUNG. When writing about taxes, he said, make frequent use of the words "probably, usually, normally and generally."

title: The Hidden Dangers of Automatic-Payment Apps
summary: For younger people, the technology has severed the connection between the things we buy and the act of paying for those things. To get a sense of how different spending is for my generation than for my parents' generation, just consider one simple transaction: a utility bill. When my parents paid their utility bill, they had to take out their checkbook, put pen to paper, write a check and then record it in their checkbook. If they didn't know how much their utility bill was, they had to be willfully ignorant.

title: How Marriage Affects Student Loans
summary: A union can trigger changes to a borrower's loan payments and eligibility for related tax breaks. Marriage can change everything for couples-in some cases even their student-loan payments.

title: One Way to Get Employees to Donate More to Charities
summary: Matching-gifts and paid-volunteer programs are among the tools being used to boost employee involvement. Should employers give their employees a bigger say in the company's charitable giving?

title: The Digital Art Market Heats Up. (And What Is Digital Art, Anyway?)
summary: Prices are rising, but buyers may not always know the risks given technology's fast pace. It's a digital age, and art is no exception

title: A TV Chef Preps Plan to Retire in Five Years
summary: An adviser suggests Ron Duprat diversify his real-estate portfolio and factor in future health-care costs. Ron Duprat is living the American dream. The 48-year-old chef, who makes appearances on cable TV and owns five homes, arrived in Florida at age 16 by boat from Haiti. He worked as a dishwasher at first.

title: Mueller Doesn't Find Trump Campaign Conspired With Russia
summary: Special counsel report leaves open questions about obstruction of justice, according to William Barr's summary. WASHINGTON-Special counsel Robert Mueller concluded that President Trump and his campaign didn't conspire or coordinate with Russia to interfere in the 2016 election, according to a letter Attorney General William Barr sent to Congress on Sunday that summarized the final report on Mr. Mueller's investigation.

title: Democrats Press On With Their Probes of Trump
summary: Pelosi and Schumer call for release of full special counsel report and all its underlying material. WASHINGTON-The first glimpse into special counsel Robert Mueller's primary findings sparked a fresh battle on Capitol Hill, with Democrats saying they would proceed with probes of the Trump administration while Republicans said their opponents should desist after Mr. Mueller didn't establish collusion between the Trump campaign and Moscow.

title: Trump Team Sees Political Gold in Mueller Findings
summary: President says he was exonerated by report, which advisers see as potential tool against Democrats vying for White House. WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.-President Trump's advisers on Sunday began crafting plans to use special counsel Robert Mueller's findings as a line of attack against Democrats ahead of the 2020 election, according to a person familiar with the matter, seeking to turn an investigation the White House long viewed as a liability into a political advantage.

title: U.S. Vessels Sail Through Taiwan Strait, Defying China
summary: The move was a show of U.S. support for Taiwan, which has grown anxious over Beijing's defense spending and assertiveness in the region. WASHINGTON-The Pentagon sent two vessels through the Taiwan Strait, a show of U.S. support for Taiwan likely to fuel concerns in Beijing that Washington is aligning increasingly with Taipei.
